thread.title: Shanghai Composite still up 73% from its 12-month low
thread.title_full: Shanghai Composite still up 73% from its 12-month low | MENAFN.COM

author: ProactiveInvestors  Australia
title: Shanghai Composite still up 73% from its 12-month low
text:
(MENAFN - ProactiveInvestors)Shares in China nosedived at the open of trading today breaking straight through the 3600 technical barrier to 3537 but there has been some respite.

Buyers have entered the market pushing the volatile index up to 3763.

Currently which is two hours in to trade the SSE Composite Index (SHA: 1) is off 1% at 3688.

Yesterday the index fell more than 8%.

While the recent pull back in Chinese stocks has been savage the current valuation of the index is still 73% higher than its twelve month low of 2135.

Trouble is - its 40% off its 5178 high from not much more than a month ago.
